title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document all functional and non-functional requirements for the GridMaster system, including performance goals, scalability, security considerations, integration with existing systems or third-party services, use cases, and high-level technical architecture and system design. Conduct stakeholder interviews, workshops, user story mapping, and create clear, concise, and comprehensive documentation to capture these requirements. Also, include specific technical components such as data models, APIs, microservices, and interfaces in the project's design.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the GridMaster system, including components, modules, and their interactions. Define the system's high-level design principles and patterns.

title: Develop Data Management Strategy
description:
Define the data management strategy, including database design, data modeling, and data integration approaches for handling complex electricity distribution network data.

1. Data storage requirements: Estimate the volume and velocity of data to be handled, and determine the appropriate database technology (e.g., relational, NoSQL, time-series) based on the data characteristics. Consider using distributed databases to handle large scale data and ensure high availability.

2. Data modeling: Design the data models and schemas to represent the complex relationships and hierarchies present in electricity distribution networks, ensuring data integrity and efficient querying. Use entity relationship diagrams (ERD) for visual representation and documentation.

3. Data integration: Define the mechanisms for integrating data from various sources, such as smart meters, sensors, and external systems, ensuring data consistency and reliability. Implement APIs and middleware services to facilitate seamless data flow and transformation.

4. Data security and privacy: Implement measures to protect sensitive data, such as customer information and network configurations, adhering to industry regulations and best practices. Utilize encryption techniques and access controls to ensure data confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

5. Data archiving and retention: Establish policies and procedures for data archiving, backup, and retention, considering legal and operational requirements. Implement data compression strategies to minimize storage costs.

6. Data access and querying: Develop strategies for efficient data retrieval, analysis, and reporting, considering the diverse needs of stakeholders (e.g., network operators, maintenance teams, billing systems). Implement SQL-based data queries and Business Intelligence tools for ad-hoc analytics and report generation.

title: Implement Automation and Optimization Algorithms
description: Develop algorithms and techniques for automating the management of electricity distribution networks and optimizing their performance.

title: Design User Interfaces - GridMaster
description: Design and develop user interfaces for monitoring, managing, and interacting with the GridMaster system. Ensure usability, accessibility, and adherence to industry standards, best practices, and our defined design system (with emphasis on responsive design considering various device sizes and screen resolutions). Collaborate with project team members during the design process. Prioritize responsive design considering various device sizes and screen resolutions. Ensure compatibility with modern browsers, while also ensuring seamless user experience across these browsers. After completion of design, conduct thorough usability testing to validate design decisions.

title: Develop Deployment and Monitoring Strategies
description: Define strategies for deploying the GridMaster system in production environments. This includes containerization (using Docker or Kubernetes), automation of deployment pipelines, selection of monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana, implementing auto-scaling and high availability with load balancers, and ensuring efficient updates through CI/CD workflows.

title: Create and Update Comprehensive Testing and Quality Assurance Plan (TQAP) for GridMaster System
description: Revise and expand the existing TQAP to include unit tests, integration tests, performance tests, acceptance criteria for the GridMaster system, and a clear outline of test scenarios. The plan should also address potential edge cases, scalability, resilience requirements, as well as testing strategies for high availability. Include guidelines on how to handle intermittent failures and test recovery mechanisms, with an emphasis on ensuring thorough coverage of all critical functionalities. Additionally, provide recommendations for improving the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.

title: Develop and Update Documentation and User Guides (Updated)
description: Update the existing documentation including system architecture diagrams, API documentation, user guides, and developer guides. Incorporate feedback from relevant stakeholders and ensure clarity, comprehensiveness, and consistency with our technical standards. Collaborate with the design team to maintain a cohesive visual style.
